data.name: JOVRNALISM
data.description:
Immersive yourself in non-fiction experiences produced by USC students, often in partnerships with media companies like ProPublica, The New York Times, NPR and many others. The JOVRNALISM™ app is a diverse collection of our stories ranging from deportation to climate change to roller derby. Created in 2015 by Robert Hernandez, a digital professor at USC Annenberg School for Communication and Journalism, the hackathon-style course brings students from across the university to use a variety of emerging technologies and push innovative storytelling forward with compelling, human experiences.

JOVRNALISM™ is generously support from the John S. and James L. Knight Foundation, Liquid Cinema, Google News Initiative, Mettle, Radiant Images and others.

Learn more here: http://www.jovrnalism.io 

Cinematic VR powered by Liquid Cinema™
